content.description:
This is an interesting problem up a split tombstone. Tension climbing down low leads up to a finger crack and a steep top out. Caution - the rock is sharp.

It is a good boulder to warm up with especially if you link these moderates with the ones in the corridor.
content.location: This problem is located on the split tombstone boulder just above and to the right of the Bukowski Boulder.

content.description: Masquerade is a classic SLV problem. Crouch start with your left hand on the lower sculpted hueco and your right hand on an undercling. Work the huecos, and throw around the corner to the right. Establish yourself on the West face using crimps and large, flat edges. Top out on the West face.
content.protection: Pads. Consider a dab pad to spot the boulder on the transfer to the west face.
content.location: Start under the striking, sculpted, hueco roof on the Northwest corner of the Bukowski Boulder.

content.description: This ascends a short and moderate arete on the east side of the corridor.
content.protection: A small pad or stem for protection.
content.location: Look for the arete on the far east (right) side of the Bukowski Boulder's south face (in the corridor).

content.description:
Climb straight up the North face just left of the clean, orange streak.

Start with a left hand undercling and your right hand on a sloper. Move up to the bad crimp/sidepull, do a tough move to a arrowhead flake, and Â finish with a exciting mantel to top it off.
content.protection: You need lots of pads to protect this well or a good spotter. There is an awkward landing on the small boulder at the base.
content.location: It is on the North face of the Bukowski Boulder just to the left of the sculpted prow.

content.description: Crouch start on a blunt arete with your left hand on a crimp and your right hand on the arete. Manage the barn door swing as you throw around the arete to a big, flat rail. Top out. Take caution of the rock in the landing.
content.protection: Pads. Stack pads to cover up the rock.
content.location:
This ascends the blunt arete to the right of

Not My Cross to Bear

.

content.description: Baby Blue Sedan is a fun dyno on poor feet in the middle of the corridor. Stand start on two crimp pockets, smear your feet on bad holds, and dyno to the rail.
content.protection: A small pad or stem for protection.
content.location: It is located in the middle of the corridor behind the Bukowski Boulder. Look for the two pockets at chest height and the rail.

content.description: Alley Cat Crack is a fun crack warm-up in the corridor. Caution - the rock is sharp.
content.protection: One small pad or use stemming for protection.
content.location: It is located on the West side of the corridor behind the Bukowski Boulder (South face).
